skills.task_description: Concatenate all .MF4 files in the folder C:\Users\ADMIN\Downloads\ev-data-pack-v10\ev-data-pack-v10\electric_cars\log_files\Kia EV6\LOG\2F6913DB\00001026\.Save the concatenated file as Kia_EV_6_2F6913DB.mf4 in the same folder.

action_plan.reasoning: Activate the asammdf application so subsequent UI interactions target the correct window
Capture current UI elements (must always call State-Tool before interacting) to find Menu and other controls
Open the Mode menu to switch to Batch processing (from KB: set_mode_batch_processing)
After opening Mode menu, capture updated UI to locate the Batch processing option (learning: must re-run State after opening Mode)
Select Batch processing mode so we can operate on multiple files (from KB: set_mode_batch_processing)
Capture the Batch processing view UI elements (Add/Open buttons, operations list) before adding files
Open File menu to use Open dialog in Batch mode (alternate to missing 'Add files' button) (from KB: open_files; learning: Add files sometimes not present so use File->Open)
Capture the File menu options to find the Open command
Open the file selection dialog to choose the MF4 files (from KB: open_files)
Capture the file-open dialog elements (address/file name field, file list, Open button). Use vision to ensure the dialog contents are visible for subsequent clicks.
Focus the File name / address field in the Open dialog so we can navigate to the target folder (from KB: open_files)
Enter the exact folder path specified by the user and press Enter to navigate there (learning: use exact folder path and press Enter)
Give the file dialog a short moment to navigate to the folder and populate the file list
Refresh the dialog state to capture the file list items in the target folder (needed to select a file before Ctrl+A)
Select one visible .MF4 file in the folder so that a subsequent Ctrl+A will select all .MF4 files (learning: must select a file first before Ctrl+A) (from KB: open_files)
Select all files in the dialog (Ctrl+A) after one file is focused to ensure all .MF4 files in the folder are highlighted (from KB: open_files; learning: select a file first)

Confirm and open the selected files into Batch processing (press Enter as an alternative to clicking the Open button when mouse-targeting is unreliable) (from KB: open_files; learning: pressing Enter can be more reliable than clicking Open)
Capture the Batch processing window now that files are loaded so we can choose the Concatenate operation and set output filename

Select the Concatenate operation for the loaded files (from KB: batch_concatenate_files). Note: choose the Concatenate control associated with batch operations (learning: if multiple 'Concatenate' controls exist, use the one in the lower/batch area).
Refresh the UI to reveal the output filename input and any options (like 'Sync using measurement timestamps') before entering the filename
Focus the output filename field in the Batch/Concatenate UI so we can type the desired output path (from KB: batch_concatenate_files)
Enter the exact output filename and path as requested by the user (from KB: batch_concatenate_files)
Ensure the Save/Start control is visible and enabled before triggering the operation
Start the concatenation by clicking the Save button (learning: the correct final action is Save, not Start) (from KB: batch_concatenate_files)
Wait for the concatenation process to complete (duration depends on file sizes; adjust if large). This pause gives the application time to finish writing the output file.
Final capture of UI state to verify the operation completed and the UI returned to an idle state (or to detect any completion dialogs/errors)
